Am I missing something?

Why a 'water dragon'; surely those are stylised cl=
ouds surrounding 
it?
Where does the Chinese connection come from; is this =
not simply a 
Japanese tsuba?
Are the ryo-hiotsu later additions?  The rims=
 appear to have been 
inserted later.
The nakago-hitsu is surprisingly lack=
ing in any signs of wear?

Regards, John L.

n

r himself. Violation

ack more than a thousand years.

e you enjoy as much as I when pondering the answers to those

rs and I would like to hear them.
